subject: RE: [junit] If a test fails (on an error), is tearDown called any	 way?
msgSnippet: My mistake.  Let s try this again. :) Yes, if your test code is called then tearDown is always called. Matt ... From: Chester Kustarz 2
messageBody:
My mistake. Let's try this again. :)

Yes, if your test code is called then tearDown is always called.

Matt

-----Original Message-----
From: Chester Kustarz 2 [mailto:chester@...]
Sent: Tuesday, October 23, 2001 1:48 PM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [junit] If a test fails (on an error), is tearDown called
any way?


On Tue, 23 Oct 2001, Di Iorio, Matthew (ISS Atlanta) wrote:
> Yes, in my experience, tearDown is always called. From the JUnit code:
>
> class TestCase {
> ...
> public void runBare() throws Throwable {
> setUp();
> try {
> runTest();
> }
> finally {
> tearDown();
> }
> }

uh, wouldn't that be tearDown() is always called iff setUp() doesn't throw
up something?

--
Chester Kustarz 2
http://www.monkey.org/~chester
